required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Resident Training on Intra-operative Workflow
clinical_study.official_title: Resident Training Affects Intra-Operative Workflow and Costs

collaborator.agency: Department of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine

brief_summary.textblock:
Anaesthesia and surgery related time intervals of three standard operations are compared depending on whether residents or consultants are performing anaesthesia and surgery.
Hypothesis: Perioperative workflow is influenced by state of education, time intervals reflecting anaesthesia as well as surgical performance increase due to resident training. Therefore, costs of perioperative care increase as well.

primary_outcome.measure: Anaesthesia and procedural related time intervals
primary_outcome.time_frame: All events will be recorded intraoperativly

secondary_outcome.measure: OR costs are calculated as $ 15.00 per minute, additional costs due to increase of time intervals will be analyzed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: All data will be recorded intraoperaitvly

clinical_study.condition: Anesthesia and Procedure Related Time Intervals

arm_group.description: 200 laparoscopic cholecystectomies will be included, consultant cases will be compared to resident cases
200 laparoscopic pelviscopies will be included, consultant cases will be compared to resident cases
200 transurethral resection of urinary bladder or prostate gland will be included, consultant cases will be compared to resident cases

intervention.intervention_name: Comparison of performance of consultants versus residents
intervention.description: Anesthesia as well as surgical workflow will be analysed. Performance of consultants will be compared to residents

study_pop.textblock: Healthy subjects scheduled for one of the three defined procedures (defined by German Diagnose Related Groups ID) under general or regional anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects scheduled for one of the three defined procedures (defined by German Diagnose Related Groups ID) under general or regional anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient's refusal of data collection, emergency procedures, change of physician in charge (resident to consultant or the other way around) of anesthesia or surgical team

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anaesthesiology and Intenisve Care Medicine, University Hospital Schleswig-Holstein, Campus Kiel

responsible_party.name_title: Jens Scholz, Professor of Anaesthesiology, Chair of the Department of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine
